EXPORT syx_bool syx_plugin_call ( SyxInterpState *  es,
syx_symbol  plugin_name,
syx_symbol  func_name,
SyxOop  method 
)

Calls a function of a plugin from within the interpreter.

If the plugin is not loaded yet, then load the plugin and call the requested primitive.

Parameters:
es the execution state
plugin_name the name of the plugin
func_name the name of the function to be called
method method to execute if the primitive fails or syx_nil
Returns:
FALSE to yield the process

Calls a function of a plugin from within the interpreter.

If the plugin is not loaded yet, then load the plugin and call the requested primitive.

Parameters:
es the execution state
method method in which the primitive call has been requested
Returns:
FALSE to yield the process

EXPORT void syx_plugin_finalize_all ( void   ) 

Finalize all plugins.

This function is usually called internally and user programs don't need to call this manually.

EXPORT syx_bool syx_plugin_unload ( syx_symbol  plugin  ) 

Close the library handle and finalize the plugin.

This function finalize the plugin but it's not sure it closes the library handler.

Parameters:
handler the plugin handler
Returns:
FALSE if the handler exists but can't be closed

Initialize the plugin system.

This function is called internally, usually applications don't need to use this function directly.

Finalize the plugin system and all loaded plugins.

This function is called internally, usually applications don't need to use this function directly.
